paper_abstract: The roughness of a set (according to the notion introduced by Pawlak in 1991) can be regarded as the MZ-distance between its upper and the lower approximations. With this idea in mind, we have generalized Pawlak's definition, by replacing the MZ-distance by a general "distance" measure. We also generalize the notion of roughness of fuzzy sets introduced by Huyhn and Nakamori in 2005. (C) 2014 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: The notion of roughness of a fuzzy set
